name: Improper Access Control for Volatile Memory Containing Boot Code
description: The product conducts a secure-boot process that transfers bootloader code from Non-Volatile Memory (NVM) into Volatile Memory (VM), but it does not have sufficient access control or other protections for the Volatile Memory.

x_mitre_content_history.submission_name: Arun Kanuparthi, Hareesh Khattri, Parbati Kumar Manna, Narasimha Kumar V Mangipudi

x_mitre_detection_methods.description: Ensure the volatile memory is lockable or has locks. Ensure the volatile memory is locked for writes from untrusted agents or adversaries. Try modifying the volatile memory from an untrusted agent, and ensure these writes are dropped.

x_mitre_observed_examples.description: Locked memory regions may be modified through other interfaces in a secure-boot-loader image due to improper access control.

x_mitre_potential_mitigations.description: Ensure that the design of volatile-memory protections is enough to prevent modification from an adversary or untrusted code.
Test the volatile-memory protections to ensure they are safe from modification or untrusted code.
